alert.note: Alert for Washtenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 3:05AM EDT until August 24 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Washtenaw County in southeastern Michigan... * Until 700 AM EDT. * At 305 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has fallen since 2 AM across northeast Washtenaw county. Additional rainfall at 1 to 2 inches per hour is likely from 3 AM to 4 AM. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ann Arbor, Ypsilanti, Dexter, Salem, Dixboro, Whitmore Lake, Willis, Barton Hills, Delhi Mills, Pittsfield Township, Hudson Mills Metropark, Hudson Mills, Whittaker and Lyndon Township. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
